comment.text: This magnesium-dependent enzyme catalyzes the hydrolysis of ATP coupled with the transport of the calcium.
ATP + H(2)O + Ca(2+)(Side 1) = ADP + phosphate + Ca(2+)(Side 2).
Isoform 1 and isoform 2 are expressed in the same tissues.
Found in most tissues except colon, thymus, spleen and leukocytes. Most abundant in keratinocytes and kidney.

disease.name: Hailey-Hailey disease
disease.description: Autosomal dominant disorder characterized by persistent blisters and suprabasal cell separation (acantholysis) of the epidermis, due to impaired keratinocyte adhesion. Patients lacking all isoforms except isoform 2 have HHD.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the cation transport ATPase (P-type) (TC 3.A.3) family. Type IIA subfamily.

property.value: P:calcium-dependent cell-cell adhesion via plasma membrane cell adhesion molecules
P:positive regulation of I-kappaB kinase/NF-kappaB signaling

feature.description: In HHD; unable to bind manganese, reduced affinity for calcium.
In HHD; unable to undergo conformational change necessary for ion transport.
In HHD; unable to bind calcium or manganese.
